title: 4 Easy Steps to Make a Gradient in GIMP

steps.title: Press G to select the Gradient fill icon.
steps.content: Press G to select the Gradient fill icon. Alternatively, you can click the Gradient Tool icon in the toolbox, which shares a button with Bucket Fill, or select the tool by going to Tools > Paint Tools > Gradient .

steps.title: Select a gradient style from the "Opacity" menu.
steps.content: Select a gradient style from the "Opacity" menu. This menu, which has a gradient icon, is in the Gradient options in the right panel. The gradient thumbnails offer various presets, like blending from pink to blue, but you can also adjust the blending options or colors to customize how it looks. You can also set the gradient shape (circular, rectangular, or linear), opacity (how much you can see through it), and if the gradient repeats. [1] X Research source If you don't see the Gradient panel, enable it in Windows > Dockable Dialogs > Tool Options .

steps.title: Click and drag the canvas to create the gradient.
steps.content: Click and drag the canvas to create the gradient. You can click and drag points on the gradient to adjust it after it's on the screen. Return to the options toolbar to further adjust how the gradient looks.

steps.title: Save the file.
steps.content: Save the file. Once you are happy with the gradient, click File and select Save . [2] X Research source
